title: Strange issue with deleted files with blocks

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: protocol
labels.description: Issues that require a change to the protocol (BEP, relay, discovery)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
Hello,

I'm currently implementing a custom implementation of the syncthing protocol and I noticed something strange with deleted files.

I know this may be a bug in my implementation, but I don't think I broke the protocol, at least according to the documentation.

I create a file on my side. Everything is fine. Then I delete it. Everything is fine, but I send this index update:

```
name: "small_new_logo2 (copie 1) (copie 1).png"
modified_s: 1490123996
deleted: true
version {
  counters {
    id: 12341524340436289198
    value: 2
  }
}
sequence: 1256
modified_ns: 235634803
Blocks {
  size: 3814
  hash: "\264]\013_G\030\243\024njt\014K24\313w\010<\370\036\355\265\022\241\2770\240L\324\345|"
}
```
Remark: I send blocks. This seems stupid, but the variable wasn't cleanup on my side when the file was deleted.
Syncthing delete the file, no problem.

Then, I add the same file again, and syncthing is stuck. The file is not added back, and I have this errors in logs:

```
(...)
[XXX] 20:23:12 INFO: Puller (folder "synctest", file "small_new_logo2 (copie 1) (copie 1).png"): shortcut: chmod: chmod /home/XXX/SyncTest/small_new_logo2 (copie 1) (copie 1).png: no such file or directory
[XXX] 20:23:12 INFO: Puller: shortcut: chmod /home/XXX/SyncTest/small_new_logo2 (copie 1) (copie 1).png: no such file or directory
[XXX] 20:23:12 INFO: Folder "synctest" isn't making progress. Pausing puller for 1m0s.
```
Sending a correct index update for a deleted file, without blocks, fix the issue.

Again, I know it's stupid to send blocks of a deleted file, it doesn't make sense. But syncthing should be able to handle the case, no ? Or the protocol definition should be updated to prevent client to send blocks ?

If needed I can try to make a PR with one of the "fix".

### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.14.24
OS Version: ArchLinux
